description: A girl who looks lifeless, her voice sounding like a man’s.

npcTexts: Sorry, there’s something I need to say...
...I’m not human...
...Please don’t report me to the government.
I swear I’m different from the others.
I’m an imposter, but I still have reason.
I want to coexist with humans.

options.playerText: Do you intend to harm me?
npcTexts: I don’t attack humans...
...I don’t eat flesh.
Well, there’s no reason really.
But if you choose to kill me, you’ll never know the truth.
If you want to know the truth...
...you can come back.
While wandering, I found this girl’s corpse.
I swear I didn’t kill her...
I parasitized her body, and somehow gained her memories.
We were created in a laboratory.
But the experiment failed, and we escaped.
We were just cells with the ability to divide extremely fast.
Perhaps my kind has already spread throughout this city.
I told you—I’m not like the others.
I have reason... There are two main types of us:
One type rational and intelligent, and one without reason.
The fastest way to maintain energy is raw flesh.
We’re drawn to humans.
But my cells can also synthesize energy on their own.
Goodbye. I know you still doubt me.
I want to exist.
To experience life as a human.

options.playerText: Are there other imposters in this house?
npcTexts: Yes, but I can’t recognize them.
Not unless they slip up.

options.playerText: How can one kill an imposter?
npcTexts: Ordinary weapons won’t work.
You see, we’re supercells...
We divide rapidly—in other words, super regeneration.

options.playerText: What do you want from me?
npcTexts: A chance. That’s all.
I want to prove to you not all of us are monsters.
Thank you for trusting me.
If that’s what you want...
I won’t resist.

options.playerText: What happens to those I report?
npcTexts: If you report the right imposter, they’ll take it away.
If you’re wrong, you’ll just see some garbage bags downstairs.
That’s all that’s left.

options.playerText: Does the government still want to study you?
npcTexts: I don’t know...
But maybe they want to create something.
Like a cloned army of perfect soldiers.

options.playerText: What if humans lived alongside your kind?
npcTexts: It wouldn’t be much different.
Humans have both good and evil too.
Life is only good when evil no longer exists.
Someday, I hope we meet again...
After tonight, I’ll be gone from here.
